body.name: Doctor's Recipes Iron 65 mg Carbonyl Iron with Vitamin C, Maximized Absorption Easy on The Stomach, Red Cells Formation, Blood, Heart, Brain, Muscle & Immunity Health, Vegan Non-GMO 60 Tablets

Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 13 hrs 5 mins
features: Sufficient Iron plus Vitamin C: Doctor’s Recipes Iron helps restore your iron levels in the body by providing 65 mg of elemental iron (from carbonyl iron). Our stomach-friendly iron formula is enriched with 250 mg of vitamin C, which helps your body absorb iron more effectively.*

Well-Tolerated, Easy-to-Swallow: Due to its gentle absorption and high (>98%) iron content, our carbonyl iron product is a better choice for iron supplementation with fewer digestive side effects and reduced tablet weight, compared with ferrous salts.

Supports Healthy Iron Levels*: Your body uses iron to make hemoglobin, a protein which carries oxygen from our lungs throughout our bodies, and myoglobin, a protein which supplies oxygen to muscles.* In addition, iron provides support for increased energy, improved focus, immune responses, and the regulation of body temperature.*

Proudly Made in the USA: Our advanced strength formula is loaded with the highest grade & naturally sourced ingredients in a GMP certified facility in the USA. Doctor’s Recipes Iron is 100% pure, natural, vegan friendly & NON-GMO with no soy, gluten and dairy.

Personal Choices, Professional Solutions: At Doctor’s Recipes, we believe the products and services should be done professionally and with enthusiasm. Doctor’s Recipes nourishes the goodness inside your body to help you maintain a healthy lifestyle. We have everything you need and nothing you don’t, and you will always know what you’re putting in your body. The name of this exceptional brand leaves little to imagination, and it’s a title well-deserved.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Gentle on the Stomach Doctor’s Recipes Iron comes in the form of carbonyl iron. This pure form of iron is easy on the stomach, due to its gentle, prolonged absorption. Iron + C Vitamin C has been shown to facilitates iron absorption. It combines with iron to form a soluble complex which is more easily absorbed by the body. Lower Tablet Weight 98% iron content enables less carbonyl iron to achieve the same unit dose than ferrous salt.
*These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good enough to avoid iron infusion
reviews.reviewText: Two months ago, my hematologist recommended iron infusions. I asked if I could try iron supplements first. He agreed. My test results showed a slight improvement, but it’s good enough. My dr said to continue with the iron supplements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable Iron Pill
reviews.reviewText: I have had problems donating plasma and I knew I needed something to get my iron up since it has always been lower than the acceptable 38 hematocrit level. What I liked about this is I could take this before bed with no side effects and then again in the morning. It did take, as online said it would, approximately 3 weeks to raise the level because I tried after 1 week and my hematocrit was 35 and had to wait on donating. I take a off brand of 5 Hour Energy, and it is true that caffeine can mess with iron absorption so I wake up & take this pill on an empty stomach and wait 2 hours minimum before taking any caffeine. On donating days I don't touch caffeine until after donating. Here's some additional advice: for extra absorption take vitamin A and B12 with this pill and DON'T TAKE CALCIUM UNTIL MINIMUM 2 HOURS LATER (same suggestion when eating meals to absorb iron). You can also cook on cast iron pans to make more iron rich food but it didn't seem to work as well as these pills. I take 1 in the morning and 1 at night everyday on an empty stomach. On donating days I wake up and eat an iron rich breakfast of a 2 egg omelet with no cheese (remember no calcium!) with mixed in tomatoes, red peppers, and broccoli. Then an hour and a half when I'm leaving my home to go donate I take 2-3 of these pills and my hematocrit was 39! I strongly suggest testing any new iron pills you buy by trying during the day to see how your body reacts. I bought a different iron pill and a liquid iron, had them both on an empty stomach before going to bed, and my heart raced all night! All I know is these pills do not do that to me plus there's vitamin c for extra absorption so I just got done buying some more. I also take as many as I do because I fast and then eat on my donation days and it does drop my already low iron even lower so I need more, but PLEASE don't just take as many as I am taking if you're unsure or are not getting your hematocrit tested because you don't want iron overload.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not stomach friendly!!!
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this iron recently and believed what is written on the bottle where it says stomach friendly.An absolute lie!! Took it on an empty stomach and had the worst pain in my stomach.Please don't believe the packaging, make sure that you eat before you take this.
